ygData.subject: Re: EQ weekend update
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Once you get a successful PS in, subsequent Strikes only have to pass the initial resist check to stick.  i.e. If a mob is beating on you and you get
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 24 Jan 2000 jhenders@... wrote:
>
> Also, dispite what GZ said about pixie strike not being broken, it looks
> like they may have changed it recently. Our guild bard wanted to duel my
> druid while we were standing around last week after the patch and he
> basically locked me up with pixie strike. I wasn't able to move once if
> I got the message and icon. This is considerably different from my tests
> with the song months ago.

Once you get a successful PS in, subsequent Strikes only have
to pass the initial resist check to stick. i.e. If a mob is
beating on you and you get either a resist message or the new
"mob has resisted..." message, it will keep beating on you.
But once you get it to stop beating on you, even a "mob has
resisted..." message will refresh the Strike. So if the bard
gets lucky and the first Strike gets through, it's pretty much
smooth sailing from then on. At least until the mob breaks
out of the mez early.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
